item.title: Crystal add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Francisco X. Stork
item.description: "Be in the world but not of the world.' The words are from Jesus. But I have not the slightest idea how to accomplish that or even if it's possible. The world will always poke you in the chest with its index finger." -- Francisco X. Stork

item.title: Crystal add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Let us accept truth, even when it surprises us and alters our views." -- George Sand

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "Mr. Powell raised an eyebrow. 'I'm a librarian,' he said. 'I always know what I'm talking about." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "From that moment on, the world was hers for the reading. She would never be lonely again. " -- Betty Smith

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "A library is like an island in the middle of a vast sea of ignorance, particularly if the library is very tall and the surrounding area has been flooded." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Daniel Handler
item.description: "It is often said that reading is a gift, but to my mind that is an insufficient description, for the size of the gift of reading is so vast that it is difficult to see what is outside its wrapping." -- Daniel Handler

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Crystal add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Crystal add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Crystal add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Crystal add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "I will take the sun in my mouth and leap into the ripe air Alive with closed eyes to dash against darkness" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Lynada Lynn Haupt
item.description: "We practice wonder by resisting the temptation to hurry past things worth seeing, but it can take work to transcend our preconceived standards for what that worth might be... This is one of the blessings of the urban nature project: without the overly magnificent to stop us in our tracks, we must seek out the more subversively magnificent. Our sense of what constitutes wildness is expanded, and our sense of wonder along with it." -- Lynada Lynn Haupt

item.title: Crystal add a quote by J.V. Cunningham
item.description: "Despise me not! And be not queasy To praise somewhat: Verse is not easy." -- J.V. Cunningham

item.title: Crystal add a quote by William Edgar Stafford
item.description: "Keep a journal, and don't assume that your work has to accomplish anything worthy: artists and peace-workers are in it for the long haul, and not to be judged by immediate results." -- William Edgar Stafford

item.title: Crystal add a quote by William Edgar Stafford
item.description: "Those who champion democracy, but make a fetish of never accepting anything they don't agree with -- what advantage do they see in democracy?" -- William Edgar Stafford

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Crystal add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith
